meanings.definition: A group of plant growth regulators that inhibit cell elongation.
meanings.sent1: The morphactins help control how plants grow by stopping cells from getting longer.
meanings.sent2: Farmers use morphactins to manage the growth of their crops.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous garden gnome sprinkled morphactins on the flowers, making them stay short and stubby.
meanings.sent4: The morphactins acted like little traffic cones, blocking the plant cells from stretching out.
meanings.sent5: In the garden, the morphactins whispered to the plants, 'No more growing taller!'

meanings.definition: Any of various synthetic compounds that regulate plant growth by inhibiting cell elongation.
meanings.sent1: Scientists have created different types of morphactins to control how plants grow.
meanings.sent2: The new morphactins are being tested to see how they affect different types of crops.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat accidentally spilled morphactins on the potted plant, causing it to stay small forever.
meanings.sent4: The morphactins were like tiny garden wizards, casting spells to keep the plants from growing too tall.
meanings.sent5: As the sun set, the morphactins worked their magic, ensuring the plants stayed compact and neat.
